Prerequisites: SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF LOWER DIVISION COURSEWORK
Course Description: ADDRESSES THE USE OF ACCOUNTING INFORMATION BY NON-FINANCIAL MANAGERS.  TOPICS INCLUDE INTERPRETATION OF ACCOUNTING INFORMATION AND THE LANGUAGE OF FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING TO EFFECTIVELY PARTICIPATE IN ACTIVITIES SUCH AS PLANNING, INVESTMENT, CONTROL AND MANAGERIAL DECISION MAKING.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
UPON COMPLETION OF THIS COURSE, STUDENTS ARE ABLE TO:
1.IDENTIFY BASIC PRINCIPLES AND CONCEPTS OF ACCOUNTING
2.INTERPRET FINANCIAL STATEMENT DATA USED IN THE DECISION-MAKING PROCESS INCLUDING THE CONCEPT OF TIME VALUE OF MONEY
3.COMPUTE RATIOS USED IN FINANCIAL STATEMENT ANALYSIS
4.PERFORM COST ANALYSIS USED IN PLANNING AND DECISION-MAKING
5.IMPROVE ORAL AND WRITTEN COMMUNICATION SKILLS
6.APPLY PRINCIPLES OF ETHICAL AND PROFESSIONAL BUSINESS CONDUCT AS THEY RELATE TO CORPORATE GOVERNANCE AND FINANCIAL STATEMENT DISCLOSURE
